items.title: Charlie Kirk: Conservative influencer who rallied a youth movement

items.content: Kirk, an influential Trump ally who at age 18 set up Turning Point USA, died in a shooting while speaking at a Utah campus event.

items.title: Young, evangelical and pro-Trump: Who was right-wing activist Charlie Kirk?
items.standfirst: Charlie Kirk, the CEO and co-founder of the conservative youth organisation Turning Point USA, was fatally shot at an event at a Utah college. Kirk was a top podcaster, culture warrior and ally of President Donald Trump. He led an effort to remake the GOP’s get-out-the-vote effort in the 2024 election based on the theory there were thousands of Trump supporters who rarely vote but could be persuaded to vote.
items.content: Charlie Kirk, the CEO and co-founder of the conservative youth organisation Turning Point USA, was fatally shot at an event at a Utah college. Kirk was a top podcaster, culture warrior and ally of President Donald Trump. He led an effort to remake the GOP’s get-out-the-vote effort in the 2024 election based on the theory there were thousands of Trump supporters who rarely vote but could be persuaded to vote.

clusters.title: 'Netanyahu willing to risk his highest diplomatic achievement in order to keep his base'
clusters.neutral_headline: Netanyahu Criticized After Strikes in Qatar

items.title: 'Netanyahu willing to risk his highest diplomatic achievement in order to keep his base'
items.standfirst: FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem as the Israeli strikes on Doha are pushing Qatar to reconsider its role as mediator in the Gaza talks. She says that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seems willing to risk his highest diplomatic achievement, the Abraham Accords, in order to keep his base, as he approves a major settlement project in the West Bank and vows that "there will be no Palestinian state".
items.content: FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem as the Israeli strikes on Doha are pushing Qatar to reconsider its role as mediator in the Gaza talks. She says that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seems willing to risk his highest diplomatic achievement, the Abraham Accords, in order to keep his base, as he approves a major settlement project in the West Bank and vows that "there will be no Palestinian state".

items.title: Strikes in Qatar: Netanyahu pushes the limits in Israel's war against Hamas
items.standfirst: The unprecedented Israeli strikes against Hamas leaders in Qatar on Tuesday revealed that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is willing to cross what were previously red lines in his mission to decapitate the Islamist movement. But there may be a high price to pay for such a risky strategy – including for the Israeli hostages still held in Gaza.
items.content: The unprecedented Israeli strikes against Hamas leaders in Qatar on Tuesday revealed that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is willing to cross what were previously red lines in his mission to decapitate the Islamist movement. But there may be a high price to pay for such a risky strategy – including for the Israeli hostages still held in Gaza.

items.title: Qatar reconsidering its mediator role in Gaza ceasefire talks after Israel strikes Doha
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu “killed any hope” of releasing hostages still held in the Gaza Strip after Israel attacked Hamas leaders in Doha, Qatar’s prime minister said on Thursday. The comments from Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani underscored the wider anger among Gulf Arab countries over Tuesday's strike that killed at least six people. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu “killed any hope” of releasing hostages still held in the Gaza Strip after Israel attacked Hamas leaders in Doha, Qatar’s prime minister said on Thursday. The comments from Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani underscored the wider anger among Gulf Arab countries over Tuesday's strike that killed at least six people. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

items.title: Netanyahu ‘killed any hope’ of hostage release with strike on Doha, Qatar’s prime minister says
items.standfirst: Sheikh Mohammed was expected to attend a U.N. Security Council meeting later Thursday, part of a diplomatic push by Qatar after the strike.
items.content: Sheikh Mohammed was expected to attend a U.N. Security Council meeting later Thursday, part of a diplomatic push by Qatar after the strike.

items.title: Qatar PM slams Netanyahu as Gulf countries rally in support
items.standfirst: Qatar’s prime minister called Israel’s strike on Doha “state terror” in an interview with CNN.
items.content: Qatar’s prime minister called Israel’s strike on Doha “state terror” in an interview with CNN.

items.title: Qatari PM says Israel 'killed any hope' of releasing hostages as criticism over Doha attack intensifies
items.standfirst: Qatar's prime minister said Israel has "killed any hope" of seeing more hostages returned from Gaza after carrying out an attack targeting Hamas leadership in his country.
items.content: Qatar's prime minister said Israel has "killed any hope" of seeing more hostages returned from Gaza after carrying out an attack targeting Hamas leadership in his country.

items.title: Trump has 'heated call' with Netanyahu over Qatar strike
items.standfirst: Donald Trump had a heated phone call with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after his military targeted Hamas inside Qatar, according to a report.
items.content: Donald Trump had a heated phone call with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after his military targeted Hamas inside Qatar, according to a report.

items.title: Israeli airstrikes ‘killed any hope’ for hostages in Gaza, says Qatari prime minister
items.standfirst: Mohammed bin Abdulrahman bin Jassim al-Thani calls for Benjamin Netanyahu to be ‘brought to justice’Qatar’s prime minister has said that Benjamin Netanyahu “killed any hope” for the remaining hostages in Gaza following Israel’s extraordinary strike on Hamas negotiators in Doha on Tuesday.In an interview with CNN on Wednesday, Mohammed bin Abdulrahman bin Jassim al-Thani called the deadly strike in the Qatari capital an act of “state terror”. Israel’s attack the previous day killed six members of Hamas who were negotiating a ceasefire deal brokered by the US and other Gulf countries. Continue reading...
items.content: Mohammed bin Abdulrahman bin Jassim al-Thani calls for Benjamin Netanyahu to be ‘brought to justice’Qatar’s prime minister has said that Benjamin Netanyahu “killed any hope” for the remaining hostages in Gaza following Israel’s extraordinary strike on Hamas negotiators in Doha on Tuesday.In an interview with CNN on Wednesday, Mohammed bin Abdulrahman bin Jassim al-Thani called the deadly strike in the Qatari capital an act of “state terror”. Israel’s attack the previous day killed six members of Hamas who were negotiating a ceasefire deal brokered by the US and other Gulf countries. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Israeli strikes in Qatar are causing Qatar to reconsider its role in Gaza talks.
Netanyahu is willing to risk the Abraham Accords to keep his political base.
Qatar's prime minister called the Israeli strike on Doha "state terror".
The strike on Doha may jeopardize the release of hostages held in Gaza.
Gulf countries are rallying in support of Qatar after the strikes.

items.title: Belarus frees 52 political prisoners, including foreigners, after visit by US delegation
items.standfirst: Move seen as effort to win US favour and sanctions relief, as crackdown on dissent continuesBelarus has released 52 prisoners of various nationalities, after a visit by a US delegation to Minsk, in Alexander Lukashenko’s latest attempt to balance ties between Russia and the west.Thursday’s prisoner release was one of the biggest of Lukashenko’s authoritarian rule, and was part of his effort to mend relations with Washington and secure sanctions relief after years of isolation. Continue reading...
items.content: Move seen as effort to win US favour and sanctions relief, as crackdown on dissent continuesBelarus has released 52 prisoners of various nationalities, after a visit by a US delegation to Minsk, in Alexander Lukashenko’s latest attempt to balance ties between Russia and the west.Thursday’s prisoner release was one of the biggest of Lukashenko’s authoritarian rule, and was part of his effort to mend relations with Washington and secure sanctions relief after years of isolation. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Riek Machar faces charges of alleged involvement in attacks against federal forces.
items.content: Riek Machar faces charges of alleged involvement in attacks against federal forces.

items.title: South Sudan charges Vice President Riek Machar with murder and treason
items.standfirst: South Sudan's Vice President Riek Machar has been charged with murder, treason and crimes against humanity for a deadly attack on a military base in March. South Sudan's government claims Machar ordered a militia known as the White Army to carry out the attack, in which more than 250 soldiers were killed.
items.content: South Sudan's Vice President Riek Machar has been charged with murder, treason and crimes against humanity for a deadly attack on a military base in March. South Sudan's government claims Machar ordered a militia known as the White Army to carry out the attack, in which more than 250 soldiers were killed.

ai_summary: South Sudan's Vice President Riek Machar faces charges.
Machar is charged with murder, treason, and crimes against humanity.
The charges relate to an attack on a military base in March.
The government claims Machar ordered the attack.
Tanks and soldiers are blocking roads near Machar's house.

clusters.title: Where does the US go after the Charlie Kirk shooting? - podcast

items.title: Where does the US go after the Charlie Kirk shooting? - podcast
items.standfirst: On Wednesday night, Charlie Kirk, an influential rightwing activist and Donald Trump ally, was shot dead at a university campus in Utah. The US president immediately blamed the ‘radical left’ but failed to mention rising violence against Democrats.This week, Jonathan Freedland speaks to the Guardian’s Washington DC bureau chief, David Smith, about the increase in political violence in the countryArchive: ABC News, ABC7, CBC National, CBS News, PBS Newshour, Charlie Kirk, NBC News, Fox News, Turning Point USA, King 5 Seattle Continue reading...
items.content: On Wednesday night, Charlie Kirk, an influential rightwing activist and Donald Trump ally, was shot dead at a university campus in Utah. The US president immediately blamed the ‘radical left’ but failed to mention rising violence against Democrats.This week, Jonathan Freedland speaks to the Guardian’s Washington DC bureau chief, David Smith, about the increase in political violence in the countryArchive: ABC News, ABC7, CBC National, CBS News, PBS Newshour, Charlie Kirk, NBC News, Fox News, Turning Point USA, King 5 Seattle Continue reading...

items.title: Trump ‘threw gasoline on the fire’ amid growing political violence, expert says
items.standfirst: Right-wing activist and close Trump ally Charlie Kirk was shot dead Wednesday during an event at a college in Utah. The assassination comes amid a surge in political violence across the United States. Todd Belt, professor and director of political management at George Washington University, told FRANCE 24 that President Donald Trump has played a significant role in fuelling tensions. Citing an eight-fold increase in threats against US lawmakers, Belt said Trump “threw gasoline on the fire” when he returned to power.
items.content: Right-wing activist and close Trump ally Charlie Kirk was shot dead Wednesday during an event at a college in Utah. The assassination comes amid a surge in political violence across the United States. Todd Belt, professor and director of political management at George Washington University, told FRANCE 24 that President Donald Trump has played a significant role in fuelling tensions. Citing an eight-fold increase in threats against US lawmakers, Belt said Trump “threw gasoline on the fire” when he returned to power.

ai_summary: Right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was shot dead at a Utah college event on Wednesday.
The US president blamed the "radical left" but did not mention violence against Democrats.
A professor stated Trump fueled tensions by "throwing gasoline on the fire".
The shooting occurred amid a surge in political violence across the United States.
The Guardian's Washington DC bureau chief discussed rising political violence.

clusters.title: Larry Ellison: Oracle co-founder who overtook Musk as world’s richest person
clusters.neutral_headline: Oracle Co-founder Briefly Overtakes Musk as Richest

items.title: Larry Ellison: Oracle co-founder who overtook Musk as world’s richest person
items.standfirst: Tycoon who briefly surpassed Elon Musk is a friend of Trump, owner of Hawaiian island and father of man who took over CBSLarry Ellison, co-founder of the software company Oracle, is having a good year. His friend Donald Trump is in the White House, his son David Ellison has taken over the storied media company CBS, and on Wednesday he surpassed his buddy Elon Musk to win the title of the “world’s richest man”.Oracle’s stock went wild with the news, pushing his fortune even higher. Ellison’s net worth shot up to $393bn, surpassing Musk’s $384bn – although, by the time markets closed on Wednesday, Musk was back ahead. Continue reading...
items.content: Tycoon who briefly surpassed Elon Musk is a friend of Trump, owner of Hawaiian island and father of man who took over CBSLarry Ellison, co-founder of the software company Oracle, is having a good year. His friend Donald Trump is in the White House, his son David Ellison has taken over the storied media company CBS, and on Wednesday he surpassed his buddy Elon Musk to win the title of the “world’s richest man”.Oracle’s stock went wild with the news, pushing his fortune even higher. Ellison’s net worth shot up to $393bn, surpassing Musk’s $384bn – although, by the time markets closed on Wednesday, Musk was back ahead. Continue reading...

items.title: Ellison Tops Musk as World’s Richest Man After $101 Billion Gain

items.content: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk to become the world’s richest person Wednesday after a jump in Oracle Corp. shares added a record amount to his fortune.

clusters.title: NATO forces shoot down Russian drones over Poland
clusters.neutral_headline: Poland Shoots Down Russian Drones Over Its Airspace

items.title: NATO forces shoot down Russian drones over Poland
items.standfirst: Polish officials say during a massive Russian air raid on Ukraine, 19 Russian drones entered Polish airspace. They say NATO forces scrambled and shot down at least four of those drones. Russia says no Polish sites were targeted for destruction, but Poland says the incursion was an intentional act. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.
items.content: Polish officials say during a massive Russian air raid on Ukraine, 19 Russian drones entered Polish airspace. They say NATO forces scrambled and shot down at least four of those drones. Russia says no Polish sites were targeted for destruction, but Poland says the incursion was an intentional act. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.

items.title: Here’s What to Know About Poland Shooting Down Russian Drones
items.standfirst: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.
items.content: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.

items.title: Poland shoots down 'huge number' of Russian drones
items.standfirst: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.
items.content: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.

ai_summary: Poland shot down Russian drones that entered its airspace on Wednesday.
NATO forces were involved in shooting down the drones.
The incident occurred during a large Russian air raid on Ukraine.
Poland's military engaged Russian assets in its airspace for the first time.
Russia stated no Polish sites were targeted for destruction.
